info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 17 at 6:42PM EDT until August 17 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN GRANT...NORTHERN BLACKFORD AND SOUTHWESTERN WELLS COUNTIES... At 641 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Montpelier to near Van Buren to near La Fontaine, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Marion, Montpelier, Van Buren, Hanfield, Mcnatts, Landess, Roll, Lake Wood, and Arcana. At 630 PM EDT...the public reported hail up to one and one quarter inches in diameter in La Fontaine. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 262 and 271. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
